intro: Tephrosia kasikiensis, commonly known as Kasiki's tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are oval to elliptic in shape. The flowers are usually yellow or white, arranged in racemes, and attract various pollinators.
